The 3 meat sandwich looked like it could have some potential from the presentation of it but the overall sandwich was bland. No wow-factor at all, non-informative employees, if you want a good sandwich I suggest the deli department in Smith's over this joint.

After seeing how quick our sandwiches came out and trying to decide exactly what to order from the endless options of ingredients, and finally taking my first bite of the toasted pesto chicken sandwich....I just knew. 

Good bye Subxxx. Hello Which Wich. So delicious! A quick lunch sandwich filled to the ends of the bread bun. And neatly cut in half in case you want to save the other half for later. I picked white bread, chicken pesto, Swiss cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushroom, and candied walnuts. And then a side of BBQ kettle chips for more crunchiness. 

What a great sandwich experience enjoyed out in the patio chairs nearby!

I went here today for the first time with about 15 co-workers.  I'm sure they were not expecting that many people on a random Tuesday during the lunch hour, but that is no excuse for unorganized, slow service.  

So, the idea here is you fill out a form to place your order (and put your name on it), and it becomes the paper bag that holds your completed sandwich.  They put the order up on a wire and push it on down the line as they put it together.  Simple system that keeps the orders in order and you pick up your sandwich when they call you name.  Yet, my very simple turkey sandwich wasn't ready until after 5 other people's sandwiches who ordered after me.  How do you screw that up?  Another of my co-workers had the same thing happen with his order.  And their sandwiches were just as basic as mine and his.

Then, as I said, I ordered a turkey sandwich, however, I truly had to take apart my sandwich to see if there was any turkey on it.  There was, but it was so minimal, I might as well have ordered the vegetarian option.  

My new job is within walking distance of this Which Wich, and I will not be going here again.
Our first time here. We will be back.   Order their shakes! I recommend the surf and turf.

We have been looking for a good sandwich place and finally found it. We shared an Italian and it was soooo good. Sure you have to build your own, but the fresh bread and ingredients make up for that. We will definitely be back to try some of the others.

Excellent new addition to the NW Vegas eateries. Which Wich has a staggering selection of sandwiches and ingredient combinations. I had the Bac-Hammon with Spicy Mayo, Caramelized Onions, Avocado, Swiss, and Pepper Jack on wheat. Flavors were great, food was fresh, and the bread was good quality. The house kettle chips are ok, but the smoothies and cookies are legit. It's also only $5.25 for any sandwich with whatever toppings and sauces you want! (Other than add ons like avocado or double meat) I can't wait to go back and try out the Cuban and a friend of mine had the MonteCristo and said it was out of this world!
Shrimp Po boy was fab but too small for $9! They have Mr. PIBB & MELLO Yellow.  Still craving shrimp. I shall return.

This place is not as complicated as everyone is making it seem!!! Super easy. You basically have 10 different types of menus that could be made into a sandwich, lettuce wrap or a salad bowl... 
The workers were helpful and friendly. 
Thankfully I came here despite these reviews about it being too complicated and chaotic!
Definitely a must try! I also love it that they have a nice variety for vegetarians, like myself :) 
Don't let the other reviews fool you!
Its a different kind of sandwich shop. You order your sandwich from a paper bag by chinking the items you like.

First time eating here and this place beats Subway and Port of Subs. As a matter of fact they don't belong in the same category. I got the Italian sub and the bread was fresh and everything in between was delicious!
Very good food, and unique take at a sandwich shop. French dip I got was great! Great staff too, at least when I went. 2 younger guys.

Which which is bomb! Definitely suggest this place to anyone! Come in,choose which sandwich you'd like by selecting the coinciding bag. On the bag has your options (cheese,topping,condiments,etc),mark them off and hand it to the line and you're set. Got the pesto chicken with feta and pesto sauce, deliciousness!

I like the fact that you can literally create almost any kind of sandwich here. It is almost like a glorified subway of sorts. I don't eat meat, so it was nice to have a few options. Not super delicious where it makes me wanting to go back. Just a place to go if I'm in the area and don't feel like anything else but a sub.

I love which wich! There are so many options and unique toppings. It's like a customizable and upgraded subway. They have a lot of healthy options as well, including customizable salads. Make sure you have stamp card, so you can get a free sandwich because you'll want to come back.

It was about 45 minutes til closing so I walked in and quickly filled out my order. I ended up getting a small cheesesteak and some treats. I had attempted to order a milkshake but they couldn't do it because they just put out the ice cream and it was too hard...? Ok, so I grabbed a rice crispy and couldn't resist grabbing a brownie too. The cheesesteak was terrible. I ended up tossing the other half. I found the meat to be really unappealing. It looked like ham, except darker. They only thing I've enjoyed here so far is the black bean patty. You can find it under the vegetarian options...it's good even for hardcore meat eaters!

Have absolutely great subs, but are on the expensive side . I would have rated them higher, but they do not service the place well.  Was dirty; food crumbs all over several tables; food from previous meals on floor; had no large cups for drinks ( all out); all out of napkins. So, bring your own napkins & cups  as subs can be messy. And maybe a broom to clean the floor ; cleaning your own table is a must!

Nice atmosphere.  The ordering is different, you pick a sandwich meat type, grab a bag which has the choices of stuff you want on sandwich, mark what you want. Take bag to counter, pay & in a few minutes your made sandwich the way you wanted it comes up. Very tasty, will try them again.
Good sandwiches, nice fresh bread and ingredients. This place reminds me of the Potbelly Sandwich chain back home.

For a sandwich shop, this is pretty darn good!  Better than Subway!  Great concept with the paper bag ordering system.  Sandwiches came out just the way we wanted them!  And, don't forgot to get a cookie - comes out fresh & hot!

Sure does live up to the name "superior sandwiches" I love this place so much. My favorite sandwich place on the face of the universe! I love how you just fill out what you want inside of standing and rehearsing your order in your head, you just fill it out in a brown paper bag. I also love how versatile they are, you don't have to get a sandwich you can get a salad or you can get it in a bowl or a wrap! I always get the same thing. Black bean patty, cheddar, ranch, black olives, red onion, pickles, tomato, lettuce. And I love getting the house chips! I'm just bummed that this is the only location but it's worth the commute!!

Which Wich has to be my favorite sub/sandwich place on the planet. So far I have yet to find another venue that meets the quality and efficiency of this particular establishment. I'm not originally from Arizona, or the southwest in general, and have never heard of such a location before, so to try this for my first time? Oh man is it good. 

Every time I visit Phoenix, I have to make a stop here. NO EXCEPTIONS. Ha-ha. It's incredibly easy to order as well! You just grab a bag from their various assortments of bags (I picked the large Ham), and just circle or mark which toppings you want! It's that easy! You can have cheese and any type of cheese mind you, Hot or cold subs, avocados, lettuce, cabbage, your choice of mustard, and dressings. You tell them EXACTLY how you would like it. 

And if you use the YELP CHECK-IN option on your smartphone, you get a FREE COOKIE. Now c'mon, a free cookie with an already delicious meal? Can't beat that!
Great sandwiches. Better than Subway and Quizno's in my opinion. A little on the small side for me though.

Only 2 girls working the night I came in. They seemed swamped with 3 other orders. I ordered their Muffaletta. I've had their Muffaletta before and love the olive spread so I ordered it with 2x's the amount. It came out about 10 minutes later with an apology for the wait but it was fresh and tasty as always. I had it toasted which makes the bread even more delectable. 

Vanilla malts are nice here as well as their kids menu where you can request a sandwich without crust. For a fast food choice Which Wich is a bright spot on variety and taste.

We stopped lunch after a doctor's appointment and I'm so glad we did! The sandwich was great and I loved the atmosphere.its definitely better than the similar type sandwich shops in the area like subway or port of subs. I love their ordering system too. It makes things way faster than the other shops! I got the wheat roll and it was so good! Being from the east coast it was closer to what you find out there than what you usually find out here. Prices were more than reasonable and all the workers were super friendly and helpful. We will be back!

I had never been here before as I live in California and we do not have this establishment.  I loved it! I got the chicken cordon bleu, you basically create your own sandwich similar to subway but Better! There's lots of choices and add ons and you choose everything down too the sauces and fixings.  I had pesto, spicy ranch,  lettuce,  tomato, and bellpeppers on my chicken cordon bleu and it was soooooo yummy. I will definitely be craving this when I'm gone.  Great service too!

First time in.... Wow! Really good. I got a skinny veggie and I loved it. 
The employees made me feel welcome. Pretty nice to walk in and not feel like you are bothering them.     YUMMY!

If it's Monday, you'll probably find me at Which Wich! We are officially addicted to double punch Mondays so we can expedite the free sandwich achievement. (Hey, it's the little things in life sometimes.) Since we've been coming for a while, I have perfected my order (almost). I order the Tomato & Avocado and skinny my 'wich for less bread. I order virtually every topping they offer, including their killer hot peppers.  The only slight disappointment is I am pretty sure they used to have hummus as a spread option, but it seems to have disappeared. If you check in on Yelp, you get a premium topping for free, so wait, maybe I could ask for hummus!

I've been here several times now, and they always surprise me with something new and tasty!
I meander through their menu (over 30 sandwiches!) and come across something different. They have unique breads that they're more than happy to describe. 
Beyond the standards, they can make it the way you want it. Friendly service, good food.. What more could you want?!

I LOVE to go to this place!  I go there about 3 times a week (sometimes). Their sandwiches taste so fresh and if you want healthy you will get that and if you just want a fun sandwich you can get that too. I personally love the Turkey sandwich because it's also fresh meat!  I also like how you have a lot of options in front of you and sometimes at other places the cashier could have trouble understanding what you say but you don't need to hear to read a paper so this is a pretty clever idea. I definitely would recommend this place because it's very kid friendly with the crayons and the kid-sized sandwich!  Hope you can check this place out!!!  Lily H.-11yrs

Love the idea and being able to build your own sandwich. I had the pulled pork and my girlfriend built her own. She loves it because she always wants a million things on her sandwich. Very friendly attentive staff sandwiches came out quick will be back

Why is everyone else writing their reviews on this listing on Hanna?? Wrong address peeps!
The actual address is:
9404 W Westgate Blvd # C102
Glendale, AZ 85305-3151
(623) 977-9424

So I had been wanting to eat here for a while, but everytime I come to Westgate it was to meet friends at one of the big restaurants there.
So I came here today on my own for lunch. It was pretty easy to figure out how to order (you pick a bag by number that corresponds to the category number on the menu then you choose your toppings)
I got the Ruben with provolone and thousand island and I substituted the sauerkraut for  coleslaw and it came toasted. I also ordered the house chips which are homemade potato chips with salt and pepper.
So I got my sandwich and was surprised at how small it was. It was significantly smaller than the sandwich places I normally go to. So I ignored the size and dove in. WOW! The bread was so good. Toasted without being dry, light. The meat was perfectly cooked, not chewy like the last sandwich I ordered at another place, the coleslaw was so good and flavorful, juicy without dripping all over the place. The chips were also really good! Now the sandwich was smaller than I am used to but it wound up being the perfect size. It was so good I can't wait to go back!

Good, solid sandwiches. They have a good assortment of sandwiches and they are all, by the very nature of their set-up/gimmick, extremely customizable. You grab the appropriate bag (chicken, turkey, etc), mark what toppings you want on your sandwich and hand it to the cashier. The first time you walk in, that unusual system can be a little confusing, but on our first visit, the cashier came out from behind the counter and happily explained it to us. I actually dig this system because, after you know what you're doing, it cuts down on mistakes. And then, when/if it does happen, it's most likely your own fault, so you have no one else to blame. Like I said, good sandwiches, friendly staff, fresh and efficient system, but nothing mind-blowing. When I'm in the area, like before catching a movie at the AMC, I'll definitely be stopping in again, but beyond that, I probably wouldn't make a trip solely to eat here.

Great selection and impersonation of an IRS tax form with their little selection menu.   Which works;  the scribble-down note part beats having to sit and wait for a guy to decide if he wants olives or not on his sandwich he's already laden down with 16 other condiments.   Reasonably fast turnaround, seems like a good price.

I like the bags that you make your selections on. I picked the Italian bag and checked off Meatball, Small, White, Hot Wich, Provolone & Parmesan, Marinara, Oregano. The guy rang us up more quickly than past visits. Got a few punches on my punch card. My sub came out piping hot! The marinara is not very "saucy" and mostly tomato chunks. The meatballs were pretty good and the bread is soft. This is not a cheap sandwich place. And I don't like their chairs- hard pieces of wood on wobbly metal legs.

What does one get with a Caprese sandwich? I really didn't have a clue so I went with the recommendations of the staff. What I really wanted to order was a Black Bean Patty, but Which Wich happened to be out of stock on this visit. :(

First off, reading Which Wich's reviews on Yelp was sure helpful in deciphering the unusual ordering process. Thanks fellow Yelpers! I was fully prepared to grab a bag and pen and start filling out bubbles for what I wanted on my 'wich.  

Employees were friendly and helpful for us first-timers. The sandwich shop was clean and had plenty of seating. Wait time was probably under 7 minutes. 

CAPRESE SANDWICH: I have to say that I like Subway better. Both me and my husband were unimpressed with the tastes of our respective sandwiches. I only ate half of my sandwich, and not for a lack of appetite. 

PRICE: The total for 2 medium subs and 2 drinks came to about $21. After a restaurant.com certificate, the total was around $13. 

Worth a return visit?
Which Wich's high-ish prices for a sandwich shop (Capriotti's is cheaper) and the location make it unlikely we'll return.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #39

This place is a step up from Subway and Port of Subs. I walked in and did not know what to do. I'm so tired of businesses making me do their job...like I work there. First, it was the grocery stores with the self-check out lanes, now Which Wich. They should at least give you an apron or a hair net, so I can feel like you're a part of the team.

So, you walk in and you have to grab your own bag with a number that corresponds to the sandwich you want. You have to basically take your own order, even though they have three perfectly capable people who should provide this service to me. I messed up on taking my own order a few times, probably because I NEVER take my own order. That's what I typically pay for, someone else taking down my order. Nope, not here and they did not compensate me for my time either.

I ordered a turkey sandwich and an artichoke and cheese sandwich with hummus. Their turkey meat is really tasty, but not worth all the work.

Their cookies are outstanding, and you are not required to write up your own order.

Who in the world thought this was a novel idea?

I wish we had one in Vacaville, CA. It's better then subway and it a simpler then most sub shops as far as what to order. 
My first time going to this place was last week. Whenever I come to visit I always pass this place up and wondered if was any good. I finally had my first which wich, and the girl who helped me made my gyro sandwich so good that I suggested to my husband that we go there to eat today. This time it was another employee that made my sandwich and let's talk about over kill with the lettuce and he totally forgot to put the gyro sauce. But on the plus side he made my husband's sandwich look amazing. 

Regardless I wouldn't mind coming back here the next time I visit.

Love this place!! Too bad there's only one in Las Vegas! I would rather eat their sandwiches over Subway and Port of Subs! 

They pretty much have the same sides as other places and more! Their bread is perfect! Since I LOVE ICE... they have crushed ice here! The customer service here is great also!!!

Love the food. Tons of options. Thank You Turkey is my absolute favorite. Punch card where you get a free sandwich after 10 sandwiches (or something like that). The only issue is the service. If it's busy it usually isn't even worth sticking around but even on a slow day it seems like it takes longer than it should. The staff is nice and always apologizes for the wait...but personally I would just rather they figure out  a faster way to make their sandwiches.
Just so so nothing about the place excited me. The prices seemed high for the small amount of meat on the sandwiches. Not sure who is slower which which or firehouse.

This is an fun little sandwich shop.

You enter and there are a variety of different little brown bags you choose from divided up by type of meat (and yes there are vegetarian options). You pick a bag and a pen.

You choose your meats, then your cheeses, then a variety of veggies, sauces, toppings, add ons, and so on and so forth. There are TONS of options.

They can thin your wich (by carving out the excess bread - which I did) to save you calories and carbs.

This was a great little shop. On par with other great sandwhich places (not Subway). Worth checking out, but nothing to drive across town about either.

The Which-Wich in Glendale, AZ is one of my favorite spots. It's a good sandwich. But the mismanagement of this location makes it not worth the stop. First time I was here they had run out of ice (pretty big deal in the desert). Today's visit was marred by: 
-long wait due to understaffing
-watching multiple customers bring sandwiches back due to wrong ingredients
-giving part of my order to someone else

What's the point of personalizing the ordering process (orders and names written on the bag) if you cannot make sandwiches correctly and get them to the right people??

Unlikely to return to this location.

Moved back from central Texas about a year ago and found the ONLY WhichWich in the city. Sadly I live across town and do not get to enjoy it as often as I'd like. 

What led it worse is that this location truly disappointed me today. The staff was so far involved in their own conversations that the level of attentiveness was below standard. 

I've been a rewards member for as long as I can remember, and the girl at the front cashed out my order without even asking if I am or would like to be a rewards member. For the company this is a disgrace. Loyalty programs are organized and put together for people like me, and it damages the company's ability to gain returning customers when not only are they not treated as a person that exists and am contributing to their livelihood by continuing to purchase food items, but as well not engage and reward your loyal customers. 

The restaurant was filthy with several dirty tables and a floor that looks like it had not seen attention for several hours. 

I truly hope my next experience at WhichWich goes smoother because this is how you do not grow in a city that is very centered around hospitality. Someone at the higher end of this franchise needs to wake up and check on their business. 

Extremely unsatisfied!

Solid sandwich for sure. The only complaint I have is in regards to their bread. It falls apart while you are eating it. Other than that, the sandwich, staff, and options are top notch. 

All the vegetables are fresh. The meats and cheeses comes in a generous amount. I got the chicken pesto sandwich on wheat bread stuffed with a bunch of spinach, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, and feta cheese, but it needed a kick. They didn't put any hot peppers into the sandwich like I asked for, but it was still really good.

The way to order is rather neat. You pick a sandwich bag and mark the items you want to add. For the amount of food you get, the prices are pretty reasonable. I could have easily made my 10 inch sub two meals, but I just kept eating.

I do not recommend this place to eat. The restaurant had 3 teenagers cooking/preparing the food. They kept there gloves on for cash transaction and to prepare the food. I order online and they had no cookies available. I switched out for a stale/hard brownie. My order was wrong had groc on the sandwich. Sandwich was nasty and to pricey for the quantity & quality. I will not ever eat and this place again. 2 thumbs down.

Sandwich joints generally fall into 3 categories for me:   1) Fast food joints like Port of Subs, Quiznos, Subway which I will only eat in an emergency or if it's free  2) Chains like Jimmy Johns, Jersey Mikes and Heidis which I feel are of a higher quality than those in 1), but not enough where I crave them often, and 3) Capriottis, which is my gold standard because of their not so standard offerings like the Capastrami and generally quality ingredients.

The concept of Which Wich seemed intriguing to me, and I especially loved the variety of options they provide in all areas of sandwich fixings like seafood, cheese whiz, black bean patties, hummus, and more.  Being the MADLY adventurous eater that I am, I threw caution to the wind and got a turkey breast sandwich on wheat with deli mustard, avocado, hot pepper mix and some veggies.  This ish cray.   So yeah, I played it safe.  My thinking was I should try something tame the first time around and if I enjoyed it I could go more adventurous in future visits.

Well WW, prepare a gyro meat sandwich with peanut butter and cheeze whiz because I very much enjoyed all aspects of my sandwich.  All of my ingredients, in particular the thinly sliced turkey breast tasted very fresh and of good quality.  The hot pepper mix provided just the right amount of kick that I needed when combined with the deli mustard and I always appreciate the ability to have spinach on a sandwich instead of lettuce.  

I thought the price was very fair, a bargain actually.  The service was very friendly, and they were all prepared to give us the lowdown on how to order when my coworker and I presented our printouts from their website (pro tip: you can conceive and mark your entire sandwich order online, print it and simply hand it to them if you want to forego the entire potential contagion scare of the shared marker concept)  

My only MINOR gripes were the location is pretty small, and during lunch rush hour it seemed a little tough to maneuver around the mix of customers and employees walking the floor.   Also, I got a combo but they didn't provide any larger bag to place my sandwich and chips in.  Trying to carry the sandwich bag and the chips separately, while certainly not difficult, would have been made a lot easier with a separate bag.   Also, when unwrapping the sandwich, it had gotten quite messy inside the bag and peeling off the paper wrap was impossible without getting my hands covered in avocado and mustard.

When I'm complaining about these sorts of things, you know I'm being nitpicky, but nitpicky is what separates a 4 star experience from a 5 star one.  A challenger to Capriottis throne has emerged.

I'm updating before posting!

So we went again this time for dinner and we got there at 8pm. Workers (2guys) were rushing us and while we were eating were sweeping and putting chairs up (it wasn't even 8:45 yet as they close at 9). Was a total turn off and we were disappointed. I am deducting 2 stars for this because it was still early enough to allow our family to finish our meal without the annoying cleaning going on. Didn't appreciate that at all. After this we agreed that we prob won't be back unless we were in the area and weren't hungry for anything else.....too bad.
Original post:
Yum-O!!! We were soooo satisfied with our sandwiches! We ordered: caprese on wheat (skinny), beef wiz on white and a kids turkey. Total came to $20.....
I added avocado but it was no charge because you get a free "add in" with yelp check in. Kids meal only came with a fruit roll up....they should let the child choose a chips or cookie IMO.  Overall I'd say this is the best sandwich place I've tried to date. This beats: firehouse, port a sub and subway for sure! Prices were decent at a regular starting at $5.50.

Have a location in the SW!!!

When I walked in....I was like "WTF". There were bags on the wall and some red sharpie markers on a counter. It took me a minute to figure it out (I'm about a green in the box of crayons...not bright like yellow, but not dark like midnight blue). Any who, the sandwiches all looked great, and I decided on the Club. It was a different kind of club than you would find at say Subway, since it had ham, turkey, and bacon, instead of roast beef. 

On said bag, you mark which ingredients you would like, hand it to the cashier and wait. It wasn't terribly busy, so the wait time was about 5.5 minutes. When I got back to the shop (I was eating with a friend @ her hair salon...great place BTW), I was pleasantly surprised. The bacon wasn't that crap microwave stuff, and it was just delectable. The sub was perfect...not too big, not too small, juuuuusssst right! They do toast it, and I'm not a big fan of toasted subs, but it was about a 2.5 on the toasted scale, and that made me happy! 

I would definitely come here again, as the subs were great, the speed of service was great, EVERYTHING was great!

This is a good sandwich.

Actually, this is a REALLY good sandwich.

The concept is actually pretty cool: Grab a bag from one of several sandwich types, customize your order to how you want it (from toasted/non-toasted bread, condiments, garnishes, etc), hand it to the cashier, wait a few minutes, and BOOM!  Tasty sandwich.

Actually, the bag idea is really clever.  It ensures that you get what you want (seeing how it's printed right there), and they do offer a lot of sandwich varieties and options within each variety.

I've been here about 3-4 times now, and have yet to have a disappointing sandwich.  Everything tastes fresh and flavorful, and they give you so many options, you can really create a great meal.They even have an "Elvis Wich" (peanut butter, bacon, honey, and banana) that looks really tasty and I need to try.  That's listed under "Comfort Foods".  Their egg salad and chicken salads are top notch.

They do their own potato chips (solid), and I discovered that they do their own milkshakes last night.

Even the staff is friendly.  Always polite, and make sure that you are enjoying your meal.  The service is fast and thorough.

It all started as a whim, going in here.  But now that I've been a few times, this is a place that I am starting to think about more and more to get my sandwich on.  And I do love a good sandwich.

And they do have a good sandwich.

They have a REALLY good sandwich.
Subway is better. Their sandwich was such lacklustre and the tuna just tasted like it was canned. On top of that the customer service was just rude.

I love Which Wich! The sandwiches are bomb.  However, this location was a let down because they only had one person working. Which meant, he had to take orders and make those same orders. With only 3 people in front of me, it took me nearly 15-20 mins just to get my sandwich which was for takeout. For a quick bite to eat during my lunch break, I don't know if I can come back if it's going to take as long as it did today.

Sooooo I went here last night with a couple friends after coughing for 10 minutes at the soap bubble "snow" and the lighting of the tree. I myself don't eat sandwiches very often..... if the fact that most my reviews are Chinese don't give that away lol. So this is a really good sandwich place..... there is 50 different sandwiches to choose from, and you can customize them from there. I got the crab salad with avacado, olives, and spicy mayo. It was pretty much a California roll on bread LOL. and it was really good. So was the oreo shakes. Decent prices, and good food. Gets a 4.5 star but can't do .5 and its more 4 than 5.... but yeah it's good.

Being from the east coast I like real meat in my Sandwich's.....not processed crap. This place was alright if I was on the go and had nothing else around, but honestly when does that ever happen??? I had a turkey sandwich and it was nothing to rave about. Go somehwere with boars head meat.
Poor staff they made so much fuss asking what you want on the wich....if i have to tell them so many times i can go to a subway instead :D

a Glorified sub shop...ehhhhh... its a unique concept, grab your own bag and mark it with what you want. Not my thing... i want to walk in somewhere look at a menu and tell a person what I want not figure it out, write it down and hand a bag to a sandwich maker. I was not impressed with the sandwich either. Subway is better and cheaper.

Which Wich--just another sandwich shop?  I don't think so.  In a land filled with Subways, Port-a-Subs, and Jimmy Johns', this place sets itself apart by offering its customers the chance to build sandwiches with more toppings than I've ever seen offered at those other joints.  My son beat me to this place before, so when we ventured there for dinner tonight, he mentored me through the ordering process.  Basically you grab a paper sandwich bag that doubles as your order form, choosing the sandwich, your meats, cheeses, sauces, condiments, vegetables toppings, as well as the size of your 'wich.'  I gave up meat for the month of March so I went with a small Caprese:  tomato, mozzarella, and pesto on a toasted wheat roll, adding lettuce as an extra topping.  My teenager, the Devil, ordered a large meatball sandwich- -the nerve!  So, we handed over our orders and after a short wait, our names were called and we went to town on our meals.  It's not very nice to sit across from a kid eating a meatball sub while you sit eating a veggie sandwich, but mine was delicious just the same.  Oh, and when I checked in using my handy Yelp phone app, I got two FREE cookies.  I went back to the counter and showed the young man my phone and he had me fill out another order form for said cookies because they are baked fresh while you wait--kewl.  Needless to say, I will be back next month so I can try the meatball sandwich my own darn self.

This is a excellent sandwich shop. They have such a variety on ingredients and sandwiches on the menu. In a nice area of Westgate and has a nice clean atmosphere. The sandwiches here are delicious. Great job Which Wich.

If I had to base my entire experience on the food itself them id say it was a 10. But the young cashier/sandwich makers that were working today were awful. They CLEARLY hate their job, and one wanted to sweep and the other wanted to do something else while my order was on the wire (Mind you I was the only person in there)and when I said thank you to the young gal for my sandwich, she just looked @ me as if I was speaking a foreign language. A shop is all about the clients experience, an due to this we will not be returning. And it was our fist time every eating here.

I am SO lucky there is not one of these shops in the city I live in. I was first introduced to one in South Carolina on a visit there a few years ago and have dreamed about it since. No joke, dreamed about it. To my pleasant surprise found this one in Vegas and I come to Vegas 2-3 times a year and will make the 20 minute trip from Either the strip or 10 minute trip from Red Rock Casino just to eat these sandwiches. Yes first time is slightly confusing ordering but just ask they'll tell you. Then you'll know for the next 20 times you come. Made exactly to order and bread toasted to perfection like seriously THIS BREAD. Service is just fine, it's a sandwich shop. I get the Italian grinder that includes three meats add black olives tomatoes and avocado and it so delish. With Yelp check in my avocado was free. (One "add on" is free including extra meat) fiancé loves this place just as much - his new wich he found on this trip is called the wicked and includes turkey, ham, roast beef, pepperoni, and bacon. The sandwiches come in small medium and large and a small suffices for me even though I'd like to get a large. The sandwiches, while packing a ton of ingredients and taste, are not too big to fit in a mouthful! Again, my waistline and bank account are grateful there's not one close to me I'd be here 2-3 times a week not a year!!!

Awesome sandwich and concept
Been a loyal customer since 2010 at this place
Stopped going to other sandwich places
Italian sandwich is the best
I get to put whatever I want in it
Love the concept

This review is strictly on the food.  I went to Which Wich yesterday and the ordering process was very unique and fun, but the sandwich I had was nothing to write home about.  I had a meatloaf sandwich under the "comfort classics" or "comfort food" category and it was gross.  The meatloaf was absolutely devoid of any flavor and just tasted like a flavorless ground beef wad.  I mean, I had cheeses and other spices that should've enhanced the meatloaf, but how can you enhance flavors when they are absent? No salt, no pepper, no ketchup coating, NOTHING! I'm not going to give up on Which Wich just because of this first bad experience, but it failed for me this go around.

The place is different.  You find a bag with your sub choice and fill it out and turn it in.  I had the French dip.  Had great flavor but was pretty small.  Bread was fresh.  Atmosphere was just ok.  It's like sitting in a fast food place.

I like the set up. It's different then most sandwich shops, makes it easier we don't have to wait in line and tell them what to put on it. They had great customer service and the sandwich was good. Ill be coming back to try the others. I'd say overall my girlfriend and I had a good experience !

Found place on yelp after a day of hiking. Starved. The ordering system is annoying, im not a fan of the bag thing. My sandwich was way overpriced, however, when it came out the medium was larger than i thought. I had to take other half home. I got the wicked with toppings and added free avocado thanks to yelp. Free add on with check in.... You will need it! I ordered a hot wich but it came put cold, none of the cheese was melted like i like. Also, by the time my sandwich came out, my two friends already at most of theirs. Not enjoyable experience.

I'm a big Which Wich fan. If you've never eaten at a WhichWich, prepare to be stoked. The scope and variety of ingredients and options is wonderful, not to mention the quality. Quite a bit better than Subway or Port of Subs. I'm bummed this is the only location in Vegas, but if you're in the area, you should definitely go. Plus, because this brand isn't as well known in Nevada as some of the others, you won't fight the lines you get elsewhere. Also, they have several veggie sandwich options that are a major step up than the cheese and cheese available elsewhere. My favorites are the Caprese and Avocado & Tomato (plus you can add almost anything you can think of).

Check in bonus of a tasty cookie. I'm not above accepting bribes!

This was my first (and hopefully not last) visit. Sandwiches were great. Prices seemed fair. And the system is great for grabbing office lunch. I was skeptical going in. But this place really does seem worth any higher prices compared to other sub shops.

Got three sandwiches and a bowl. Milkshakes are legit chocolate shake out of this world hot cookies and ice cream place is awesome plus I does caring for schools and offices the back way DiLisio so. Great variety. Vegan to meat subs best bread.
Very good food. Great flavors and amazing bread. Very friendly staff too
The best sandwich I've ever had.  The service was excellent, and staff were top notch. Diego was awesome.

Great location getting in, but getting out turning left is not easy.  Other than that it's in a great convenient location.  
The staff is friendly and helpful when you are deciding which wich to choose.  :) 
Lots of different options.  I like that they have real avocado. YUM! 
When you go in you choose your bag and write your options down on the bag.  Then take it up to the counter and they ring you up.  Nice to be able to write your name on the bag so you hear your name, not just a number.  
Great concept and plenty of options to choose from.  The shakes are yummy, but small.  Good option to make it a meal with chips and a drink, but nothing healthy for a side item like a fruit cup.  
The bread is really soft and easy to bite into as I have an issue with tough/rubbery bread.  
I've been 3 times and will definitely go back!

I did not have a great sandwich here but I believe I ordered badly and next time I will try something different. I was there at about 11 a.m. and to me that is when a breakfast sandwich is an option. 
It is a little different from most sandwich stores. You pick out a sandwich bag, a marker and then you fill in dots alongside the ingredients listed on aforesaid bag. It felt like homework.
So I order bacon, egg, feta cheese and wheat bread. I did not oder it toasted. Upon opening the wrapper the sandwich self disrupted. The bacon is bacon bits, NOT rashers. They spilled everywhere, the egg was ok but the cheese was cold { should have toasted it} . Bacon should not be in a jar. Period.
So, a big disappointment but I will go again and order a non bacon sandwich and give the review an update.

PS. Check in on Yelp before your order and you'll get a free add-on.

So the owner asked me to give them another try. Always wanting to give an accurate and complete review I did.

I was assured the markers and counters are cleaned regularly throughout the dayand the mess I saw and felt the first time wasnt there that night. 

The food was still fresh and tasted amazing so Im updating the review saying the mess and chaos from my first trip was likely from a rush and not the norm at this store. Im giving them top marks.

They deserve it!

How much wich would a which wich wich if a which wich could which wich?

Now that we have that out of the way, let's talk about one of my favorite things: sandwiches. Which wich is a joint that I've visited several times and I have no qualms about. The location is pretty great with it being next to my gym, movie theater and several stores and it's right off the freeway. 
The sandwiches are well made with a nice courteous staff with no complaints. The prices are fair, there's never too much of a crazy wait. In terms of sandwich hierarchy I'd put it above subway, port of subs and jersey mikes  but below Capriottis, firehouse subs and Jason's deli
Overall, they're a good sandwich place that doesn't disappoint, but they're more of a "if you're in the area" and less of a "I'm going to make a drive" type of sandwich place
Always great service and great sandwiches.  Great location at Westgate, right by the parking lot.  This is my go to place when I venture to Westgate.
